Summary Innovator, result oriented leader with extensive experience in technical senior management, engineering program management (Platform, Software, Firmware, Hardware), product development (custom/ASIC), Corporate Life Cycles, product management and business strategies. Proven track record in problem solving, creating comprehensive strategies, developing high-performing and result oriented teams. High performing manager with positive employee feedbacks, great attention to employee career development and training. Direct involvement in resource allocation and hiring. Lead cross discipline and global engineering teams.  
 
Shahram has BS (Magna Cum Laude), MSEE in Electrical Engineering from University of Minnesota as well as MBA from University of California Davis. He hold 9 patents. He has been one of the authors for computer engineering handbook (first and second edition). He completed his MBA from UC Davis in June 2008 with emphasis in Finance and Marketting. He has also taken UC Berkelety Intel Executive Leadership Development Program in 2007 which were offered to selective Intel senior management.  
 
Shahram has been involved in community volunteering activities his entire career. He has volunteered in different organizations such as Leukemia Lymphoma Society , Sacred Heart Community, Family Giving Tree, etc. He has been volutneering for Leukemia Lymphoma society since summer of 2004. He has acted as a mentor in the organization helping participants to acheive their fundraising goals, understand mission/goal of organization as well as train and complete what is often their first marathon. 
 
Shahram enjoys travalling, meeting people and experiencing different cultures. He has travelled to 22 countries and over 100+ different cities. He also enjoys running and exercising. He completed 8 marathons (Santa Barbara 1, Napa 3, Portland 1, Nike-SF 1, Big Sur 1, Athens 1) and numerous half marathons,10k,5k,etc. Summary Innovator, result oriented leader with extensive experience in technical senior management, engineering program management (Platform, Software, Firmware, Hardware), product development (custom/ASIC), Corporate Life Cycles, product management and business strategies.
